lines.text: If thine eye offends thee, pluck it out. If thine own hand offends thee, then in God's name, cut it off!
You want me to run just because you can't find a killer?
I'm Faith. F-A-I-T-H, like in believe.
I'll be damned if these guys don't eat brimstones for breakfast.
His people? His people turned their backs on him! YOU ordered it!
[last lines]
and they that dwell on the earth shall wonder.
You are a stench in the nostrils of God!
[in reference to Martha's land]
If I owned a piece of property like this and I kicked the bucket, my parents would start building condos on it on the way home from the funeral!

[holding a gun]
Oh well, it doesn't take an Einstein to pull the trigger.
INCUBUS! INCUBUS!
Father Isaiah said this place was with the incubus! If he knew...
So who are these Hittites anyway, Amish, or what?
No connection. According to Martha, the Hittites make the Amish look like swingers.
I feel like I've been in a time warp. There's no jets, planes, telephone polls, or power lines.
What's a warp?
That's when someone from the twentieth century wakes up one morning back in the eighteenth century.
Touch me there again and I'll scream!
I hope its a girl! Boys ain't nothin but trouble.
Hey, how's the champ?
I'm fine. Vickys done everything but inject me with chicken soup.
Men around here's hopeless!
I don't suppose the sheriff's been much good.
No, as a matter of fact all he does is tell us to get out.
Well, I wouldn't be surprised if he was a Hittite himself.
[Trying to elicit the Incubus]
Thou tell me thy name, the date, and thy hour of coming out! I command thee!
Already, we're history.
[first lines]
In the rolling hills of a sinful farm community, untouched by time, a gruesome secret has been protected for generations.
What's an incubus?
It's some kind of demon that stalks the faithful in their sleep, or just comes and takes you like a beast!
Oh God...
